title: Explore the File Menu Options
text: While looking at the top of your Google Sheets interface, locate the 'File' menu. This menu contains various options related to file operations, including saving, importing, and exporting files.

title: Identify the Right Item
text: The 'File' menu in Google Sheets includes an option to duplicate or clone your current spreadsheet. This is often located near the top of the list.

title: Understanding 'Make a copy'
text: The option you are looking for typically uses the phrase 'Make a copy'. This allows you to create an identical duplicate of your current spreadsheet.

hintAnswer: Select 'Make a copy' from the File menu.
title: Use the 'Make a copy' Instruction
text: Select 'Make a copy' from the File menu to create a new copy of your spreadsheet.
choices: Select 'Save as' from the File menu.
Rename your spreadsheet to add the words 'Copy of' to the beginning of the title.
Click the Save button and select 'Save a copy' from the pop up.
Select 'Make a copy' from the File menu.
